title: Typical Usage
text: Let’s set health atlas. example, going use Chicago Health Atlas, can , providing Chicago Health Atlas URL ha_set(). anytime, need check health atlas using, can using ha_get(). can list topics (aka indicators) present within Chicago Health Atlas using ha_topics(). important column topic_key can used identify topic within subsequent functions. Often, may topic area interested exploring. can explore topic areas using ha_topic_subcategories(). can use subcategory_key subset list topics . topic topics mind, can explore populations, time periods, geographic scales data available using ha_coverage(). , important columns key columns can used specify data desired.
code: library(healthatlas) ha_set("chicagohealthatlas.org") ha_get() #> [1] "https://chicagohealthatlas.org/api/v1/" topics <- ha_topics(progress = FALSE) topics #> # A tibble: 403 × 7 #>    topic_name           topic_key topic_description topic_units subcategory_name #>    <chr>                <chr>     <chr>             <chr>       <chr>            #>  1 9th grade education… EDA       Residents 25 or … % of resid… Education        #>  2 ACA marketplace enr… ENR       Number of plan s… plan selec… Access to Care   #>  3 Accidents mortality  VRAC      Number of people… count of d… Injury & Violen… #>  4 Accidents mortality… VRACR     Age-adjusted rat… per 100,00… Injury & Violen… #>  5 Active business lic… CHANVYI   Count of active … licenses p… Income           #>  6 Adult asthma         HCSATH    Number of adults… count of a… Chronic Disease  #>  7 Adult asthma rate    HCSATHP   Percent of adult… % of adults Chronic Disease  #>  8 Adult binge drinking HCSBD     Number of adults… count of a… Alcohol & Drug … #>  9 Adult binge drinkin… HCSBDP    Percent of adult… % of adults Alcohol & Drug … #> 10 Adult diabetes       HCSDIA    Number of adults… count of a… Chronic Disease  #> # ℹ 393 more rows #> # ℹ 2 more variables: subcategory_key <chr>, category <chr> subcategories <- ha_topic_subcategories() subcategories #> # A tibble: 30 × 3 #>    subcategories_name    subcategories_key     category_name        #>    <chr>                 <chr>                 <chr>                #>  1 Access to Care        access-to-care        Clinical Care        #>  2 Quality of Care       quality-of-care       Clinical Care        #>  3 Community Safety      community-safety-1    Physical Environment #>  4 Housing & Transit     housing-transit       Physical Environment #>  5 Pollution             pollution             Physical Environment #>  6 Resource Availability resource-availability Physical Environment #>  7 Behavioral Health     behavioral-health     Morbidity            #>  8 Chronic Disease       chronic-disease-1     Morbidity            #>  9 Infectious Disease    infectious-disease-1  Morbidity            #> 10 Injury & Violence     injury-violence-1     Morbidity            #> # ℹ 20 more rows ha_topics("diet-exercise") #> # A tibble: 20 × 7 #>    topic_name           topic_key topic_description topic_units subcategory_name #>    <chr>                <chr>     <chr>             <chr>       <chr>            #>  1 Adult fruit and veg… HCSFV     "Number of adult… count of a… Diet & Exercise  #>  2 Adult fruit and veg… HCSFVP    "Percent of adul… % of adults Diet & Exercise  #>  3 Adult physical inac… HCSPA     "Number of adult… count of a… Diet & Exercise  #>  4 Adult physical inac… HCSPAP    "Percent of adul… % of adults Diet & Exercise  #>  5 Adult soda consumpt… HCSS      "Number of adult… count of a… Diet & Exercise  #>  6 Adult soda consumpt… HCSSP     "Percent of adul… % of adults Diet & Exercise  #>  7 Easy access to frui… HCSFVA    "Number of adult… count of a… Diet & Exercise  #>  8 Easy access to frui… HCSFVAP   "Percent of adul… % of adults Diet & Exercise  #>  9 High School fruit a… YRFV      "Number of Chica… count of s… Diet & Exercise  #> 10 High School fruit a… YRFVP     "Percent of Chic… % of stude… Diet & Exercise  #> 11 High School physica… YRPA      "Number of Chica… count of s… Diet & Exercise  #> 12 High School physica… YRPAP     "Percent of Chic… % of stude… Diet & Exercise  #> 13 High School physica… YRPI      "Number of Chica… count of s… Diet & Exercise  #> 14 High School physica… YRPIP     "Percent of Chic… % of stude… Diet & Exercise  #> 15 High School soda co… YRSO      "Number of Chica… count of s… Diet & Exercise  #> 16 High School soda co… YRSOP     "Percent of Chic… % of stude… Diet & Exercise  #> 17 Middle School physi… YRMPA     "Number of Chica… count of s… Diet & Exercise  #> 18 Middle School physi… YRMPAP    "Percent of Chic… % of stude… Diet & Exercise  #> 19 Middle School physi… YRMPI     "Number of Chica… count of s… Diet & Exercise  #> 20 Middle School physi… YRMPIP    "Percent of Chic… % of stude… Diet & Exercise  #> # ℹ 2 more variables: subcategory_key <chr>, category <chr> coverage <- ha_coverage("HCSFVAP", progress = FALSE) coverage #> # A tibble: 168 × 6 #>    population_key population_name population_grouping period_key layer_key #>    <chr>          <chr>           <chr>               <chr>      <chr>     #>  1 ""             Full population ""                  2022-2023  place     #>  2 ""             Full population ""                  2023       place     #>  3 ""             Full population ""                  2021-2022  place     #>  4 ""             Full population ""                  2022       place     #>  5 ""             Full population ""                  2020-2021  place     #>  6 ""             Full population ""                  2021       place     #>  7 ""             Full population ""                  2020       place     #>  8 ""             Full population ""                  2018       place     #>  9 ""             Full population ""                  2017       place     #> 10 ""             Full population ""                  2016       place     #> # ℹ 158 more rows #> # ℹ 1 more variable: layer_name <chr>

title: Typical Usage
text: Now, can import data using ha_data() specifying keys identified .
code: ease_of_access <- ha_data(   topic_key = "HCSFVAP",   population_key = "",   period_key = "2022-2023",   layer_key = "neighborhood" ) ease_of_access #> # A tibble: 77 × 7 #>    geoid      topic_key population_key period_key layer_key  value standardError #>    <chr>      <chr>     <chr>          <chr>      <chr>      <dbl>         <dbl> #>  1 1714000-35 HCSFVAP   ""             2022-2023  neighborh…  57.9          6.86 #>  2 1714000-36 HCSFVAP   ""             2022-2023  neighborh…  54.7          6.25 #>  3 1714000-37 HCSFVAP   ""             2022-2023  neighborh…  45.5          7.45 #>  4 1714000-38 HCSFVAP   ""             2022-2023  neighborh…  56.9          5.86 #>  5 1714000-39 HCSFVAP   ""             2022-2023  neighborh…  52.4         10.5  #>  6 1714000-4  HCSFVAP   ""             2022-2023  neighborh…  71.7          5.49 #>  7 1714000-40 HCSFVAP   ""             2022-2023  neighborh…  36.8          6.73 #>  8 1714000-41 HCSFVAP   ""             2022-2023  neighborh…  65.9          7.52 #>  9 1714000-42 HCSFVAP   ""             2022-2023  neighborh…  48.4          8.27 #> 10 1714000-1  HCSFVAP   ""             2022-2023  neighborh…  56.7          4.96 #> # ℹ 67 more rows

title: Typical Usage
text: can check layers can import ha_layers(). Since just downloaded data Community Area level, let’s import Community Area geographic layer ha_layer(). Let’s map data!  map looks pretty good, perhaps point layer may provide insight spatial variation ease access fruits vegetables. can use ha_point_layers() list point layers available Chicago Health Atlas. Grocery store locations may important aspect ease access fruits vegetables. can import layer providing point_layer_uuid ha_point_layer(). Now imported grocery stores, let’s layer top map.  expected, seems areas grocery stores higher percent adults report easy get fresh fruits vegetables. typical use case healthatlas, explored every function healthatlas offer. Now ’s time explore.
code: layers <- ha_layers() layers #> # A tibble: 4 × 4 #>   layer_name      layer_key    layer_description                       layer_url #>   <chr>           <chr>        <chr>                                   <chr>     #> 1 Community areas neighborhood The city of Chicago is divided into 77… https://… #> 2 ZIP Codes       zip          The ZIP code is a basic unit of geogra… https://… #> 3 Census Tracts   tract-2020   Census tracts are small geographies de… https://… #> 4 Chicago         place        Cities, towns, villages, and boroughs,… https://… community_areas <- ha_layer("neighborhood") library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(ggplot2)  map_data <- community_areas |>   left_join(ease_of_access, "geoid")   plot <- ggplot(map_data) +   geom_sf(aes(fill = value), alpha = 0.7) +   scale_fill_distiller(palette = "GnBu", direction = 1) +   labs(     title = "Easy Access to Fruits and Vegetables within Chicago",     fill = "Percent of adults who reported\nthat it is very easy for them to\nget fresh fruits and vegetables."   ) +   theme_minimal() plot point_layers <- ha_point_layers() point_layers #> # A tibble: 10 × 3 #>    point_layer_name                      point_layer_uuid point_layer_descript…¹ #>    <chr>                                 <chr>            <chr>                  #>  1 Acute Care Hospitals - 2023           67f58fa0-0dfa-4… ""                     #>  2 Chicago Public Schools - 2023         5a449804-a2cc-4… ""                     #>  3 Federally Qualified Health Centers -… 22f48fd6-ee98-4… ""                     #>  4 Federally Qualified Health Centers (… f224b3ce-6d83-4… ""                     #>  5 Grocery Stores                        7d9caf3c-75e6-4… "All chain grocery st… #>  6 Hospitals                             8768fad7-65a2-4… "https://hifld-geopla… #>  7 Nursing Homes                         379a55c7-e569-4… "https://hifld-geopla… #>  8 Pharmacies and Drug Stores            93ace519-6ba2-4… "All chain pharmacies… #>  9 Skilled Nursing Facilities - 2023     93bc497d-3881-4… ""                     #> 10 WIC Offices - 2023                    7c8e9992-4e25-4… ""                     #> # ℹ abbreviated name: ¹​point_layer_description grocery_stores <- ha_point_layer("7d9caf3c-75e6-4382-8c97-069696a3efbf") plot +   geom_sf(data = grocery_stores, size = 0.5)

what: Explore and Import Metopio Health Atlas Data and Spatial Layers
title: Explore and Import Metopio Health Atlas Data and Spatial Layers
text: Explore Import Metopio Powered Health Atlases. Metopio helps many public health departments build curated data platforms. data platforms convenient way community members researchers explore download public health data. spirit mind, package aim make interfacing data portals within R painless reproducible. Note: unofficial R wrapper Metopio Health Atlases. package way affiliated Metopio public health departments Metopio serves. Examples Metopio health atlases include: Chicago Health Atlas: https://chicagohealthatlas.org/ Cook County Health Atlas: https://cookcountyhealthatlas.org/ Idaho Oregon Community Health Atlas: https://idahooregoncommunityhealthatlas.org/ Northern Kentucky Atlas: https://atlas.northernkentuckyusa.com/

title: Explore and Import Metopio Health Atlas Data and Spatial Layers
text: can install development version healthatlas GitHub :

title: Explore and Import Metopio Health Atlas Data and Spatial Layers
text: Set health atlas. example, going use Chicago Health Atlas, can , providing Chicago Health Atlas URL ha_set(). can list topics (aka indicators) present within Chicago Health Atlas using ha_topics(). important column topic_key can used identify topic within subsequent functions. , can explore populations, time periods, geographic scales data available using ha_coverage(). , important columns key columns can used specify data desired. Now, can import data using ha_data() specifying keys identified . Let’s create map. first, need download Community Areas geographic layer. can ha_layer(). Now can make map!
code: library(healthatlas) ha_set("chicagohealthatlas.org") ha_topics(progress = FALSE) #> # A tibble: 403 × 7 #>    topic_name           topic_key topic_description topic_units subcategory_name #>    <chr>                <chr>     <chr>             <chr>       <chr>            #>  1 9th grade education… EDA       Residents 25 or … % of resid… Education        #>  2 ACA marketplace enr… ENR       Number of plan s… plan selec… Access to Care   #>  3 Accidents mortality  VRAC      Number of people… count of d… Injury & Violen… #>  4 Accidents mortality… VRACR     Age-adjusted rat… per 100,00… Injury & Violen… #>  5 Active business lic… CHANVYI   Count of active … licenses p… Income           #>  6 Adult asthma         HCSATH    Number of adults… count of a… Chronic Disease  #>  7 Adult asthma rate    HCSATHP   Percent of adult… % of adults Chronic Disease  #>  8 Adult binge drinking HCSBD     Number of adults… count of a… Alcohol & Drug … #>  9 Adult binge drinkin… HCSBDP    Percent of adult… % of adults Alcohol & Drug … #> 10 Adult diabetes       HCSDIA    Number of adults… count of a… Chronic Disease  #> # ℹ 393 more rows #> # ℹ 2 more variables: subcategory_key <chr>, category <chr> ha_coverage("EDA", progress = FALSE) #> # A tibble: 132 × 6 #>    population_key population_name population_grouping period_key layer_key #>    <chr>          <chr>           <chr>               <chr>      <chr>     #>  1 ""             Full population ""                  2018-2022  place     #>  2 ""             Full population ""                  2022       place     #>  3 ""             Full population ""                  2017-2021  place     #>  4 ""             Full population ""                  2021       place     #>  5 ""             Full population ""                  2016-2020  place     #>  6 ""             Full population ""                  2015-2019  place     #>  7 ""             Full population ""                  2019       place     #>  8 ""             Full population ""                  2014-2018  place     #>  9 ""             Full population ""                  2018       place     #> 10 ""             Full population ""                  2013-2017  place     #> # ℹ 122 more rows #> # ℹ 1 more variable: layer_name <chr> data <- ha_data(   topic_key = "EDA",   population_key = "",   period_key = "2018-2022",   layer_key = "neighborhood" ) data #> # A tibble: 77 × 4 #>    geoid      measure value standardError #>    <chr>      <chr>   <dbl>         <dbl> #>  1 1714000-35 EDA      96.1          4.64 #>  2 1714000-36 EDA      98.5          4.64 #>  3 1714000-37 EDA      96.0          6.93 #>  4 1714000-38 EDA      97.0          4.69 #>  5 1714000-39 EDA      98.4          7.34 #>  6 1714000-4  EDA      96.1          3.18 #>  7 1714000-40 EDA      97.5          6.86 #>  8 1714000-41 EDA      99.0          5.27 #>  9 1714000-42 EDA      96.3          3.63 #> 10 1714000-1  EDA      93.9          2.72 #> # ℹ 67 more rows layer <- ha_layer(   layer_key = "neighborhood" ) layer #> Simple feature collection with 77 features and 6 fields #> Geometry type: MULTIPOLYGON #> Dimension:     XY #> Bounding box:  xmin: -87.94011 ymin: 41.64454 xmax: -87.52419 ymax: 42.02305 #> Geodetic CRS:  WGS 84 #> # A tibble: 77 × 7 #>    layer_key    geoid     name  population state notes                  geometry #>  * <chr>        <chr>     <chr>      <int> <chr> <chr>        <MULTIPOLYGON [°]> #>  1 neighborhood 1714000-1 Roge…      55454 IL    Far … (((-87.65456 41.99818, -… #>  2 neighborhood 1714000-… Norw…      41069 IL    Far … (((-87.78002 41.99742, -… #>  3 neighborhood 1714000-… Jeff…      26201 IL    Far … (((-87.75264 41.96798, -… #>  4 neighborhood 1714000-… Fore…      19579 IL    Far … (((-87.72642 41.99726, -… #>  5 neighborhood 1714000-… Nort…      17522 IL    Far … (((-87.7069 41.98309, -8… #>  6 neighborhood 1714000-… Alba…      48549 IL    Far … (((-87.70404 41.97356, -… #>  7 neighborhood 1714000-… Port…      63038 IL    Nort… (((-87.75264 41.96798, -… #>  8 neighborhood 1714000-… Irvi…      51911 IL    Nort… (((-87.69475 41.96128, -… #>  9 neighborhood 1714000-… Dunn…      43120 IL    Nort… (((-87.77621 41.93846, -… #> 10 neighborhood 1714000-… Mont…      14412 IL    Nort… (((-87.78942 41.91752, -… #> # ℹ 67 more rows library(dplyr) library(ggplot2)  map_data <- layer |>   left_join(data, "geoid")   ggplot(map_data) +   geom_sf(aes(fill = value), alpha = 0.7) +   scale_fill_distiller(palette = "GnBu", direction = 1) +   labs(     title = "9th Grade Education Rate",     fill = ""   ) +   theme_minimal()

title: List Topic Coverage — ha_coverage
text: List combinations population, periods, geographic layers available given topic. search individual topics use ha_topics().

title: List Topic Coverage — ha_coverage
text: topic_key Unique ID specifying topic. layer_key Character string vector Unique IDs geographic layers. progress Display progress bar?

title: List Topic Coverage — ha_coverage
text: Topic coverage tibble

title: List Topic Coverage — ha_coverage
code: ha_set("chicagohealthatlas.org")  ha_coverage("POP", progress = FALSE) #> # A tibble: 1,666 × 6 #>    population_key population_name population_grouping period_key layer_key #>    <chr>          <chr>           <chr>               <chr>      <chr>     #>  1 ""             Full population ""                  2018-2022  place     #>  2 ""             Full population ""                  2022       place     #>  3 ""             Full population ""                  2017-2021  place     #>  4 ""             Full population ""                  2021       place     #>  5 ""             Full population ""                  2016-2020  place     #>  6 ""             Full population ""                  2020       place     #>  7 ""             Full population ""                  2015-2019  place     #>  8 ""             Full population ""                  2019       place     #>  9 ""             Full population ""                  2014-2018  place     #> 10 ""             Full population ""                  2018       place     #> # ℹ 1,656 more rows #> # ℹ 1 more variable: layer_name <chr>

title: Obtain Data — ha_data
text: Obtain data one topics within specificied populations specified time periods geographic scale. combinations topic, population, period, layer returned. Warnings generated invalid combinations.

title: Obtain Data — ha_data
code: ha_data(topic_key, population_key, period_key, layer_key, wide = FALSE)

title: Obtain Data — ha_data
text: topic_key Character string vector Unique IDs specifying topics. population_key Character string vector Unique IDs population stratifications. period_key Character string vector Unique IDs time periods. layer_key Character string vector Unique IDs geographic layers. wide Pivot wider row contains values topics within population specified time period geographic area?

title: Obtain Data — ha_data
text: Data tibble containing value standard error topic measure.

title: Get Health Atlas Portal — ha_get
text: Get health atlas currently connected .

Lurie Children's Hospital Of Chica… (-87.62178 41.89645) #>  6 Ascension Resurrection Medical Center                (-87.81431 41.9871) #>  7 Ascension Saint Joseph                              (-87.63745 41.93467) #>  8 Community First Medical Center                      (-87.76777 41.94523) #>  9 Hartgrove Hospital                                   (-87.76745 41.8657) #> 10 Humboldt Park Hospital                              (-87.69944 41.90052) #> # ℹ 23 more rows

title: List Topics — ha_topics
code: ha_set("chicagohealthatlas.org")  ha_topics("education", progress = FALSE) #> # A tibble: 4 × 7 #>   topic_name            topic_key topic_description topic_units subcategory_name #>   <chr>                 <chr>     <chr>             <chr>       <chr>            #> 1 9th grade education … EDA       Residents 25 or … % of resid… Education        #> 2 College graduation r… EDE       Residents 25 or … % of resid… Education        #> 3 High school graduati… EDB       Residents 25 or … % of resid… Education        #> 4 Preschool enrollment  EDG       Percentage of 3-… % of toddl… Education        #> # ℹ 2 more variables: subcategory_key <chr>, category <chr>
